bug.short_desc: No virtual drive can be listed neither mounted.
bug.cf_doc_type: If docs needed, set a value

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem: In a Gnome session, while a target folder for an iso file to be mounted is selected (in my set /run/media/a_user), the tool opens just an empty Konqueror window, but no virtual drive at all listed.
Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable): 6.7-16.fc24 | x86_64
How reproducible:
Steps to Reproduce: 1. In Mount | Mount select an iso file to be mounted. 2. Select a target folder. 3. Create a virtual drive.
Actual results: No virtual drive can be listed neither mounted.
Expected results: The virtual drive to be listed and mounted.

I'm not sure what a virtual drive is in this context, to be honest. However, this ancient crufty program needed to be updated for modern syntax (for konsole and kdesu) to actually do _anything_ at all. I'm sorely tempted to retire this thing, as there are much better ways to view ISOs in GNOME (like Nautilus).
But, since the fixes for mounting/unmounting are pretty obvious, I'll make an update. Please test it as best you can.
AcetoneISO-6.7-19.fc25 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 25. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2017-2c6432f719
AcetoneISO-6.7-19.fc26 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 26. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2017-5819f8a7a2

AcetoneISO-6.7-19.fc25 has been pushed to the Fedora 25 testing repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report. See https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/QA:Updates_Testing for instructions on how to install test updates. You can provide feedback for this update here: https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2017-2c6432f719
